settings.heading: RESTORE YOUR SKIN’S YOUTHFUL BEAUTY
settings.title: Radio Frequency Microneedling
settings.body: Our skin is designed to protect us from the sun’s rays and the environment, and in our youth, it does this very well. Over time, however, damage can accumulate in the cells, making our skin look older and more weathered. This displays through fine lines and wrinkles, age spots, sun damage, hyperpigmentation, and other skin irregularities. At Balanced Aesthetics, we have the latest RF microneedling technology to restore your skin’s youthful beauty from the inside out.

settings.text: RF Microneedling is a safe treatment for nearly any skin type because the RF energy bypasses the skin’s surface and does not react with melanin, so there’s minimal risk of hyperpigmentation. Your Balanced Aesthetics specialist will evaluate your skin’s condition during your consultation to determine how many treatments will achieve your aesthetic goals. Inform your provider of all your skin concerns along with any medications you’ve taken within the past 30-days (including topical).

Results are visible after just one session, but a series of sessions are always suggested for optimal results. Your skin will show an immediate radiance, and as it heals, your new complexion will reveal itself. Your improvements will accumulate with a series of treatments, giving you a smooth, even, youthful glow. Collagen fibers take time to form, so your skin will continue to tighten, and wrinkles will diminish for up to 3 months following your treatments.

settings.question: How Does RF Microneedling Work?
settings.answer:
We are proud to house one of the most innovative Radio Frequency (RF) Microneedling machines available, Cutera’s Secret™ Pro (a combination of previous models – Secret™ RF and Fraxis Pro). Our patients receive a highly effective skin tightening and microneedling combined treatment with minimal downtime, unlike your traditional microneedling service. It works by creating a series of tiny, controlled injuries on the skin’s surface to promote its natural healing response. Then, radiofrequency energy is delivered through these channels to precise depths within the skin, where it reacts to contract cells and stimulates collagen production. Our Fraxis PRO’s advanced bipolar RF energy coagulates tissue causing a hemostatic response to stimulate collagen remodeling. The ‘smooth motor’ tip reduces discomfort for the optimal patient experience. New skin cells replace the damaged cells, and new collagen fibers form to renew the skin at the cellular level for better support and a firmer, more youthful appearance.

RF Microneedling:

• Helps with treating acne

• Builds collagen

• Is proven to help treat hair loss

• Minimizes large pores

• Diminishes and minimizes hyperpigmentation (dark spots/patches on your skin) from sun damage, hormonal changes, and environmental causes

• Tightens skin and improves elasticity

• Minimizes scars and stretch marks

• Helps reduce fine lines and wrinkles

• Shrinks enlarged pores

settings.question: What is the Treatment Like?
settings.answer: Your skin will be thoroughly cleansed before treatment, and a topical anesthetic can be applied to maximize your comfort. Once you’re ready, the Secret™ Pro’s microneedling device is passed over your skin in controlled sweeps to achieve total coverage of the treatment area. After your treatment, you’re free to return to most of your everyday activities. Consistent use of sunscreen is extremely important if you’re outdoors for long.

settings.question: Is There Any Downtime?
settings.answer: Minor pain and redness can occur during and, for a short period, after treatment. The skin may flake off (peel) and feel tighter than usual for several days following treatment. There is a very low risk of infection due to tiny holes being made in the skin during treatment. Wait at least 8-12 hours before wearing makeup or using heavy facial products. Keep your skin as clean as possible, and do not touch the treated area for up to 4-8 hours directly after treatment to avoid clogged pores or infection. Contact your provider if you experience continuous burning, redness, or swelling of the treated area.
